title: Hanson singer Zac reveals he is recovering from motorcycle crash
text:
Zac Hanson, the youngest member of the band Hanson, is now in a hospital recovering from injuries he suffered in a motorcycle crash in Oklahoma.

He 'wrecked' his motorcycle as he was getting ready for a cross-country ride in Tulsa on Wednesday.

The MMMBop singer, 33, came out of the accident with 'three broken ribs, a broken collarbone, and a cracked scapula.'

He took to Twitter, Facebook and the band's official website to tell the story on Friday.

'… Nothing is injured that won't heal with a little rest and time, and a healthy dose of gaming,' he wrote alongside a photo of himself in a hospital room next to his brother and bandmate Isaac.

'Thankfully with good quality protective gear, I was able to walk away, even if very slowly with the help of Issac [Hanson], Taylor [Hanson], and a few of Tulsa fire fighters,' he added.

Survivor: He 'wrecked' his motorcycle as he was getting ready for a cross-country ride in Tulsa on Wednesday

Zac confirmed that the band will not cancel any upcoming concerts due to the accident.

His close pal Dash Hutton will fill in for him as drummer while he recovers from his injuries.

Zac and his brothers Issac, 38, and Taylor, 36, landed on the music industry map in the 1990s with the release of their hit single MMMBop.

The three continued to rack up three Grammy nominations and sold 16M albums across the globe.

Hanson's most recent album, String Theory, came out in November 2018.

But despite their rapid rise to success, fame was never on Zac's radar in the first place.

'We were lucky that we grew up really loving music that was before our time and studying that,' he told Entertainment Tonight back in 2017.

'… I think that's really the key to surviving fame, to not think that you represent fame and not think that it makes or breaks you. That's not why you got there in the first place and it's gonna be long gone before you are.'
